name: db_mysql

db_mysql/dump/prefix.description: The prefix that will be used to name/locate the backup of a particular MySQL database.  Defines the prefix of the MySQL dump filename that will be used to name the backup database dumpfile along with a timestamp.

db_mysql/dump/container.description: The cloud storage location where the MySQL dump file will be saved to or restored from. For Amazon S3, use the bucket name.  For Rackspace Cloud Files, use the container name.

db_mysql/dump/storage_account_provider.description: Select the cloud infrastructure where the backup will be saved. For Amazon S3, use ec2.  For Rackspace Cloud Files, use rackspace.

db_mysql/backup/cron_backup_minute.description: Defines the minute of the hour when the backup will be taken.

db_mysql/backup/rackspace_secret.description: In order to write the dump file to the specified cloud storage location, you will need to provide cloud authentication credentials. For Rackspace Cloud Files, use your Rackspace account API Key.

db_mysql/admin/password.description: The password of the database user that has 'admin' privileges.

db_mysql/backup/storage_container.description: The cloud storage location where the MySQL dump file will be saved to or restored from. For Amazon S3, use the bucket name.  For Rackspace Cloud Files, use the container name.

db_mysql/backup/aws_access_key_id.description: In order to write the dump file to the specified cloud storage location, you will need to provide cloud authentication credentials. For Amazon S3, use AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID.

db_mysql/application/password.description: The password of the database user that has 'user' privileges.

db_mysql/dump/storage_account_id.description: In order to write the dump file to the specified cloud storage location, you will need to provide cloud authentication credentials. For Amazon S3, use AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID. For Rackspace Cloud Files, use your Rackspace login Username.

db_mysql/backup/lineage.description: The prefix that will be used to name/locate the backup of a particular MySQL database.

db_mysql/dump.display_name: Import/Export settings for MySQL dump file management.

db_mysql/backup/cron_backup_hour.description: Defines the hour when the backup will be taken.

db_mysql/application/user.description: The username of the database user that has 'user' privileges.

db_mysql/backup/keep_yearly.description: The number of yearly backups to keep (i.e. rotation size).

db_mysql/admin/user.description: The username of the database user that has 'admin' privileges.

db_mysql/fqdn.description: The fully qualified hostname for the MySQL Master Database.

db_mysql/backup/rackspace_user.description: In order to write the dump file to the specified cloud storage location, you will need to provide cloud authentication credentials. For Rackspace Cloud Files, use your Rackspace login Username.

db_mysql/backup/volume_size.description: Total volume size in GB.  This input only applies for EBS volume storage and is ignored otherwise.

db_mysql/backup/aws_secret_access_key.description: In order to write the dump file to the specified cloud storage location, you will need to provide cloud authentication credentials. For Amazon S3, use AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY.

db_mysql/log_bin.description: Defines the filename and location of your MySQL stored binlog files.  This sets the log-bin variable in the MySQL config file.  If you do not specify an absolute path, it will be relative to the data directory.

db_mysql/backup/keep_weekly.description: The number of weekly backups to keep (i.e. rotation size).

db_mysql/backup/max_snapshots.description: The maximum number of backups to keep in addition to those being rotated.

db_mysql/backup/keep_monthly.description: The number of monthly backups to keep (i.e. rotation size).

db_mysql/backup/storage_type.description: The type of cloud storage that will be used to store the backup.  For Amazon S3 or Rackspace Cloud Files, use 'ros' and for Amazon EBS, use 'volume'

db_mysql/server_usage.description: Use 'dedicated' if the mysql config file allocates all existing resources of the machine.  Use 'shared' if the MySQL config file is configured to use less resources so that it can be run concurrently with other apps like Apache and Rails for example.

db_mysql/backup/stripe_count.description: Number of EBS volumes in a stripe.  This input only applies for EBS volume storage and is ignored otherwise.

db_mysql/dump/storage_account_secret.description: In order to write the dump file to the specified cloud storage location, you will need to provide cloud authentication credentials. For Amazon S3, use AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY. For Rackspace Cloud Files, use your Rackspace account API Key.

db_mysql/dump/schema_name.description: Enter the name of the MySQL database schema to which applications will connect.  The database schema was created when the initial database was first set up.  This input will be used to set the application server's database config file so that applications can connect to the correct schema within the database.  This input is also used for MySQL dump backups in order to determine which schema is getting backed up.  Ex: mydbschema

db_mysql/backup/keep_daily.description: The number of daily backups to keep (i.e. rotation size).

long_description:
= DESCRIPTION:

Configures MySQL database servers that act as a Master-DB. Specifically designed for RightScale's Manager for MySQL-EBS. Storage of MySQL data will be done using EBS Volumes. EBS Snapshots are used for database backups.

= REQUIREMENTS:

* The Opscode's public cookbooks must be in your cookbook path -- the 'mysql' cookbook is used for client install.

= ATTRIBUTES: 

See metadata.rb 

= USAGE:

Designed to be run within a RightScale ServerTemplate with the following run order:

Boot Scripts
  * install_mysql - Performs base server install and configuration.

Definitions
  * db_mysql_restore - Restores database from MySQL dump retrieved from a remote location.
  * db_mysql_set_privileges - Configures a user's privileges.  Currently only 'administrator' and 'user' settings are supported.

recipes.db_mysql::setup_continuous_backups_cloud: Updates the crontab for taking continuous binary backups of the MySQL database. Backups are saved to a Rackspace Cloud Files container.
recipes.db_mysql::do_restore_cloud_files: Restores the MySQL database from a binary backup saved in the specified Rackspace Cloud Files container.
recipes.db_mysql::do_dump_import: Initializes the MySQL database with a dumpfile from the specified cloud storage location. (i.e. S3, cloudfiles)
recipes.db_mysql::setup_application_privileges: Adds username and password for application privileges.
recipes.db_mysql::do_force_reset: Reset the DB back to a pristine state.
recipes.db_mysql::install_client_5.0: Installs the MySQL 5.0 client packages and gem.
recipes.db_mysql::do_disable_continuous_backups_: Disables continuous EBS backup Snapshots of the MySQL database by updating the crontab.
recipes.db_mysql::setup_block_device: Creates, formats and mounts the block_device (volume) to the instance.
recipes.db_mysql::do_disable_continuous_backups_: Disables continuous binary backups of the MySQL database to a Rackspace Cloud Files container by updating the crontab.
recipes.db_mysql::do_backup_s3: Create a binary backup of the MySQL database and save it in the specified Amazon S3 bucket.
recipes.db_mysql::do_backup_ebs: Creates an EBS backup EBS storage
recipes.db_mysql::do_backup: Creates a backup of the MySQL data to the specified cloud storage location. (Premium Account Only)
recipes.db_mysql::do_dump_export: Uploads a MySQL dumpfile archive to the specified cloud storage location. (i.e. S3, cloudfiles)
recipes.db_mysql::do_backup_cloud_files: Create a binary backup of the MySQL database and save it in the specified Rackspace Cloud Files container.
recipes.db_mysql::install_mysql: Installs the packages that are required for MySQL servers.
recipes.db_mysql::do_restore_s3: Restores the MySQL database from a binary backup saved in the specified Amazon S3 bucket.
recipes.db_mysql::setup_continuous_backups_ebs: Updates the crontab for taking continuous backups of an EBS-based database. Backups are saved as EBS snapshots of the attached EBS Volume or EBS (Volume) Stripe.
recipes.db_mysql::setup_continuous_backups_s3: Updates the crontab for taking continuous binary backups of the MySQL database. Backups are saved to an Amazon S3 bucket.
recipes.db_mysql::do_restore: Restores the MySQL database using a backup from the specified cloud storage location. (Premium Account Only)
recipes.db_mysql::setup_continuous_export: Schedules the daily run of do_dump_export.
recipes.db_mysql::install_client: Installs the MySQL 5.1 client packages and gem.
recipes.db_mysql::do_disable_continuous_backups_: Disables continuous binary backups of the MySQL database to an Amazon S3 bucket by updating the crontab.
recipes.db_mysql::setup_admin_privileges: Adds the username and password for 'superuser' privileges.

description: Installs/configures a MySQL database server with automated backups.
